ds.util
Interface List<T>

All Superinterfaces:
Collection<T>, java.lang.Iterable<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArrayList, LinkedList, OrderedList
public interface List<T>
extends Collection<T>

A collection of elements that are stored by position (also known as a sequence). The first element is at position (index) 0. The interface extends the Collection interface and gives the user control over where in the list each element is inserted. The user can access elements at their position (index) in the list and and search for elements in the list. Unlike sets, lists typically allow duplicate elements. More formally, lists typically allow pairs of elements obj1 and obj2 such that obj1.equals(obj2).

The general list add inserts an element at the end of the sequence with duplicate elements allowed. The interface provides four methods for indexed access to the elements. Their implementations in the LinkedList class have running time O(n) and so should be used with caution. All methods that access a position that is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size()) throw IndexOutOfBoundsException. However, the indexed add method can insert an element at index size() in the sequence.

The List interface provides a special iterator, called a ListIterator, that allows element insertion and replacement, and bidirectional access in addition to the normal operations that the Iterator interface provides. A method is provided to obtain a list iterator that starts at a specified position in the list.

listIterator

ListIterator<T> listIterator()
Returns a list iterator of the elements in this list.

Returns:
a list iterator of the elements in this list.

listIterator

ListIterator<T> listIterator(int index)
Returns a list iterator of the elements in this list, starting at the specified position in this list. The index is the location of the first element that would be returned by an initial call to the next method. An initial call to the previous method would return the element at position index-1.

Parameters:
index - position of the first element to be returned from the list iterator (by a call to the next method).
Returns:
a list iterator of the elements in this list starting at the specified position in this list.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index > size()).
